Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=106503903


On Jul 16, 2004, at 11:57 PM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>
>> JUnit is the de facto standard, but it's the TestCase
>> interface, not anything else. Or am I mistaken?
>
> The framework is what's standard, and not the test runners. Correct.
> -- 
> J. B. Rainsberger,
>

Sometimes this argument seems to get a little slippery.  Seems whenever 
someone complains about some peculiarity of TestSuite, that suddenly 
it's in the same category as the runners.

What constitutes the "framework"?  Just the Test interface (that would 
probably be the absolute minimum)? I keep getting the impression here 
that anything anyone is unhappy with is "not really part of the 
framework, you should write your own if you don't like it", as opposed 
to a positive definition which states what is part of the framework, 
why, and why it needs to never be changed.

  I hate hearing the implication "the code never changes so it must be 
really good code".   The only thing that unchanging code implies is 
that no one has changed it.
subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
